target_sent: ’Tis politic and safe to let him keep At point a hundred knights!
source_sent: Ourself by monthly course, With reservation of an hundred knights By you to be sustained, shall our abode Make with you by due turn.

target_sent: Conceive, and fare thee well.
source_sent: Thou but remembrest me of mine own conception.

target_sent: O, the difference of man and man!
source_sent: — Is man no more than this?

target_sent: Here do you keep a hundred knights and squires, Men so disordered, so debauched and bold, That this our court, infected with their manners, Shows like a riotous inn.
source_sent: Ourself by monthly course, With reservation of an hundred knights By you to be sustained, shall our abode Make with you by due turn.

target_sent: Thou art not vanquished, But cozened and beguiled.
source_sent: Tremble, thou wretch, That hast within thee undivulgèd crimes Unwhipped of justice.

target_sent: Who can arraign me for ’t?
source_sent: I will arraign them straight.

target_sent: This trusty servant Shall pass between us.
source_sent: Give me my servant forth.

target_sent: What need you five-and-twenty, ten, or five, To follow in a house where twice so many Have a command to tend you?
source_sent: What, must I come to you With five-and-twenty?

target_sent: Where is my lord of Gloucester?
source_sent: Why Gloucester, Gloucester, I’d speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.

target_sent: —  You, sir, more knave than Fool, after your master.
source_sent: — Where’s my knave, my Fool?

target_sent: The gods to their dear shelter take thee, maid, That justly think’st and hast most rightly said.

target_sent: Of Albany’s and Cornwall’s powers you heard not?
source_sent: Cornwall and Albany, With my two daughters’ dowers digest the third.

target_sent: In your own kingdom, sir.
source_sent: I am the King himself.

target_sent: This is not altogether fool, my lord.
source_sent: Dost thou call me “fool,” boy?

target_sent: I pray you, go Along with me.

target_sent: Sirrah, come on: go along with us.
source_sent: Take heed, sirrah — the whip.

target_sent: And your large speeches may your deeds approve, That good effects may spring from words of love.
source_sent: Mend your speech a little, Lest you may mar your fortunes.

target_sent: The same, Your servant Kent.
source_sent: Kent, on thy life, no more.

target_sent: As ’tis said, the bastard son of Gloucester.
source_sent: I know thee well enough; thy name is Gloucester.

target_sent: How does my royal lord?
source_sent: I am the King himself.

target_sent: Soon may I hear and see him.
source_sent: I have not seen him this two days.

target_sent: Soon may I hear and see him.
source_sent: I have not seen him this two days.

target_sent: For thee, oppressèd king, I am cast down.
source_sent: I am the King himself.

target_sent: — O dear father, It is thy business that I go about.

target_sent: — O dear father, It is thy business that I go about.

target_sent: Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?
source_sent: Let her be thine, for we Have no such daughter, nor shall ever see That face of hers again.

target_sent: So young, my lord, and true.
source_sent: So young and so untender?

target_sent: Sir, do you know me?
source_sent: Dost thou know me, fellow?

target_sent: O, thou good Kent, how shall I live and work To match thy goodness?
source_sent: Kent, on thy life, no more.

target_sent: This speech of yours hath moved me, And shall perchance do good.
source_sent: I will preach to thee.

target_sent: What I should deny —  As this I would, though thou didst produce My very character — I’d turn it all To thy suggestion, plot, and damnèd practice.
source_sent: Thou shalt find That I’ll resume the shape which thou dost think I have cast off forever.

target_sent: He hath commission from thy wife and me To hang Cordelia in the prison, and To lay the blame upon her own despair, That she fordid herself.
source_sent: O most small fault, How ugly didst thou in Cordelia show, Which, like an engine, wrenched my frame of nature From the fixed place, drew from my heart all love And added to the gall!

target_sent: Know of the Duke if his last purpose hold, Or whether since he is advised by aught To change the course.
source_sent: This act persuades me That this remotion of the Duke and her Is practice only.

target_sent: What sayest thou to him?
source_sent: And art thou come to this?

target_sent: I shall serve you, sir, Truly, however else.
source_sent: Thou shalt serve me — if I like thee no worse after dinner.

target_sent: Thou, Nature, art my goddess.

target_sent: She and the Duke, her husband.

target_sent: If thou ’rt noble, I do forgive thee.

target_sent: If thou dost As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way To noble fortunes.
source_sent: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes.

target_sent: It shall lose thee nothing.

target_sent: Here’s France and Burgundy, my noble lord.
source_sent: The two great princes, France and Burgundy, Great rivals in our youngest daughter’s love, Long in our court have made their amorous sojourn And here are to be answered.

target_sent: In fellow, there, into th’ hovel.
source_sent: — Come, bring us to this hovel.

target_sent: Is ’t not the King?
source_sent: I am the King himself.

target_sent: — And the noble and true-hearted Kent banished!
source_sent: Kent, on thy life, no more.

target_sent: I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund; If more, the more th’ hast wronged me.

target_sent: Therefore, thou happy father, Think that the clearest gods, who make them honors Of men’s impossibilities, have preserved thee.
source_sent: Thy truth, then, be thy dower, For by the sacred radiance of the sun, The mysteries of Hecate and the night, By all the operation of the orbs From whom we do exist and cease to be, Here I disclaim all my paternal care, Propinquity, and property of blood, And as a stranger to my heart and me Hold thee from this forever.

target_sent: Draw thy sword, That if my speech offend a noble heart, Thy arm may do thee justice.
source_sent: Hide thee, thou bloody hand, Thou perjured, and thou simular of virtue That art incestuous.

target_sent: — Want’st thou eyes at trial, madam?
source_sent: Thou serv’st me, and I’ll love thee.

target_sent: Obey thy parents, keep thy word’s justice, swear not, commit not with man’s sworn spouse, set not thy sweet heart on proud array.
source_sent: That thou hast sought to make us break our vows —  Which we durst never yet — and with strained pride To come betwixt our sentence and our power, Which nor our nature nor our place can bear, Our potency made good, take thy reward: Five days we do allot thee for provision To shield thee from disasters of the world, And on the sixth to turn thy hated back Upon our kingdom.

target_sent: Bless thee from whirlwinds, star-blasting, and taking!
source_sent: Blasts and fogs upon thee!

target_sent: How light and portable my pain seems now When that which makes me bend makes the King bow!
source_sent: The bow is bent and drawn.

target_sent: Haste thee for thy life.
source_sent: Resolve me with all modest haste which way Thou might’st deserve or they impose this usage, Coming from us.

target_sent: What’s he that speaks for Edmund, Earl of Gloucester?
source_sent: Why Gloucester, Gloucester, I’d speak with the Duke of Cornwall and his wife.

target_sent: ’Tis noble Kent, your friend.
source_sent: Kent, on thy life, no more.

target_sent: That thou wast born with.
source_sent: Better thou Hadst not been born than not t’ have pleased me better.

target_sent: Speak less than thou knowest, Lend less than thou owest, Ride more than thou goest, Learn more than thou trowest, Set less than thou throwest; Leave thy drink and thy whore And keep in-a-door, And thou shalt have more Than two tens to a score.
source_sent: Thou shalt serve me — if I like thee no worse after dinner.

target_sent: Whoop, Jug, I love thee!
source_sent: Thou serv’st me, and I’ll love thee.

target_sent: That lord that counseled thee To give away thy land, Come place him here by me; Do thou for him stand.

source_sent: Take heed, sirrah — the whip.

target_sent: Take the Fool with thee.

target_sent: Now, sweet lord, You know the goodness I intend upon you; Tell me but truly, but then speak the truth, Do you not love my sister?
source_sent: I know you do not love me, for your sisters Have, as I do remember, done me wrong.
